channel.title: Question about client class names
channel.description:
Hello everyone,
My question is why are the client class names named so weird, example:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/QvbeO.png[/img]
It is really hard to understand what the code does this way :|
[i](Is there any client source that has better class names?)[/i]
Thanks!

item.title: Question about client class names
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

The client was obfuscated, when we deobfuscated it the class names and variables have been changed to: [tt]Class#[/tt] and [tt]anInt#[/tt], [tt]aBoolean#[/tt], etc.

And in case you’re wondering what all this means, obfuscation in general, describes a practice that is used to intentionally make something more difficult to understand, in this context it means to make code harder to understand or read, generally for privacy or security purposes.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about client class names
item.dc:creator: @DefLegende DefLegende
item.description:
@DefLegende wrote:

Thank you very much!

Read full topic

item.title: Question about client class names
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

http://code.google.com/p/rename317/

While I wouldn’t agree with some of the names, I don’t think you’ll find one that at least attempts it at this level.

There is also http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/srcAllDummysRemoved.tar.gz which is better off than the one you have now

Read full topic
